name: Phlox
description: Phlox is a genus of about 70 species of annuals and perennials in the family Polemoniaceae, mostly native to North America.These plants have thick, strong stems, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The flowers have five petals that come in a wide range of colors. They are hardy and easy to grow in a variety of conditions.
meaning: The genus name comes from the Greek word for flame or light, in reference to the flower color of many species.
color_description: There are many different color varieties available, such as white, yellow, pink, purple, red, lavender, rose, magenta.
